DataElement.preferredName: Vaginal Brachytherapy Intracavitary Perpendicular Axis Middle Administered Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the intracavitary vaginal brachytherapy dose at 0.5 cm from the surface of the applicator.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Vaginal Brachytherapy Intracavitary Perpendicular Axis Middle Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to intracavitary (administration of a drug within any natural, nonpathologic cavity, such as that of cervix, uterus, or penis) vaginal brachytherapy administered to the axis perpendicular (a straight line through a body or figure that is at a right angle to a given line or plane) to the midpoint (an area that is approximately central within some larger region) of the applicator.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the vagina or to any sheath.:(ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the vagina.
A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

Property.preferredName: Intracavitary Route of Administration Perpendicular Axis Middle Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: Administration of a drug within any natural, non-pathologic cavity, such as that of cervix, uterus, or penis.:A straight line through a body or figure that is at a right angle to a given line or plane.:An intermediate part or section; an area that is approximately central within some larger region.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug within any natural, non-pathologic cavity, such as that of cervix, uterus, or penis.
A straight line through a body or figure that is at a right angle to a given line or plane.
An intermediate part or section; an area that is approximately central within some larger region.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ValueDomain.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
